dialogue.text: And sometimes, even knowing it's a trick doesn't make it worthless. Overwhelm at the vastness.

psychological_notes: The architect makes a crucial point about conscious use of psychological tools - knowing something is a 'trick' or illusion doesn't necessarily diminish its utility. This mature perspective then transitions to Evan's overwhelm at vastness, connecting the personal (identity repair) to the cosmic (infinite possibility).
philosophical_underpinning: Conscious illusion as valid tool; transition from personal to universal
